definition: to take root/to establish a base
to plant
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to be rooted to/to take root in

sentences.english: It's a poem deeply invested, in fact, in the entire Western tradition of poetry in general.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，這是一首植根於，西方詩歌傳統的詩。

sentences.english: I feel fairly rooted in Japan.
In the plateau region associated with natural flesh deep feelings, is a root.
sentences.chinese: 在高原地區與自然血肉相聯的深刻感受，是一種植根。

sentences.english: That mission is "deeply engrained in the culture, " he adds.
sentences.chinese: 這個使命“深深植根於企業文化之中”，他補充道。

sentences.english: Peng Xuejun′s juvenile novels are rooted in a unique image of the South.
sentences.chinese: 彭學軍的少年小說創作植根於一種獨特的南方映象。

sentences.english: Afterwards, sensationalism places its root in Hong Kong media.
sentences.chinese: 從該時開始，煽情主義在香港植根。

sentences.english: This dream deeply rooted in the dreams of the literati.
sentences.chinese: 這個夢深深植根於文人夢之中。

sentences.english: His strength and confidence, however, hide a deely reflective spirit.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲他那植根於心的精神蘊涵着力量和信心。

sentences.english: The ancient Yelang Country is produced in the karst environment.
sentences.chinese: 古夜郎國植根於喀斯特環境。

sentences.english: Ancestral worship has long been at the heart of Orcish religion.
sentences.chinese: 祖先的崇拜之物已經深深的植根語獸人的宗教之中。

sentences.english: Rooted in tradition, learning from nature's painting masters.
sentences.chinese: 植根傳統，師法造化的國畫大師。

sentences.english: Wenzhou's private sector is also rooted in the city's network of informal banks.
sentences.chinese: 溫州私營部門也植根於當地的民間銀行網絡之中。

sentences.english: Anti-Chinese sentiment is also deeply rooted in Indonesian culture for the past 50 years.
sentences.chinese: 反華情緒也深深植根於印尼的文化在過去50年。

sentences.english: Responsibility talk is deeply embedded in political worldviews.
sentences.chinese: 對於責任討論是深深植根於政治世界觀的。

sentences.english: In China, "the four masterpieces of literature" are deeply rooted in the hearts of Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，“四大文學名著”深深植根於人們的心中。

definition: to be rooted to/to take root in
to take root
fertile land
deep roots and vigorous foliage (idiom)/(fig.) well established and growing strongly
air plant (Bryophyllum pinnatum)/to put down roots
deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
deep-rooted (problem etc)
deep plowing and careful cultivation
homeland/hot piece of real estate
cultural tradition
fertile soil
to set (sth) afoot/to initiate/beginning/origin/commencement
intensive farming
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
to grow and multiply without end
